thefinalpackage

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • thefinalpackage.BasicNavigator
        • thefinalpackage.Navigator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigator
extends BasicNavigator
    Navigator class is responsible for turning , traveling and detecting objects to avoid. The class also extends BasicNavigator class.
    Author:
    DPM TEAM 01

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean avoid)
        Method to travel to X and Y coordinate on the field with option of avoiding or not avoiding the obstacle. TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading When avoid=true, the nav thread will handle traveling. If you want to travel without avoidance, this is also possible. In this case, the method in the Navigation class is used.
        Parameters:
        x - (double) : X coordinate of the field we want the robot to travel to.
        y - (double) : Y coordinate of the field we want the robot to travel to.
        avoid - (boolean) : if True then travel to destination with avoiding obstacle on the way. If False then travel to a straight to the desired destination

      • run

        public void run()
        Method to start the Thread. The Method calls other Methods and is responsible for checking the current state of the robot. Please view the software architecture version 3.0 for a detailed description of this class
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double angle)
        The Method turn the robot the desired angle on the gride, it is absolute turning, also determines the minimum angle to trurn
        Parameters:
        angle - : desired angle of the roboton the grid

      • goForward

        public void goForward(double distance,
             boolean avoid)
        Method to Go foward a set distance in cm with or without avoidance.
        Parameters:
        distance - (double) : desired distance to travel
        avoid - (boolean) : True to avoid obstacle on the way , False to not avoid obstacle

      • isTravelling

        public boolean isTravelling()
        Method to check if the robot is navigating
        Returns:
        (boolean) True : robot is navigating , False : robot is not navigating
